intro: Sesamum calycinum subsp. calycinum, commonly known as the African sesame, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Pedaliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, brown seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and agricultural studies.
